privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: This Privacy Policy describes how Arken Academy (hereinafter referred to as 'We', 'Our Platform', 'Company') collects, uses, stores, and protects users' personal data (hereinafter referred to as 'User', 'You') when using the website https://arken.academy and its related services.

items.title: 1. Information Collection
items.subtitle: We collect the following categories of data:
items: Identification data: name, email address, phone number, country of residence, IP address.
Financial information: payment details used only for transaction verification purposes.
Technical data: device type, operating system, browser, cookies, site activity data.
Educational preferences: courses of interest, test responses, and learning progress.

items.title: 2. Purpose of Processing Personal Data
items.subtitle: Collected data is used for the following purposes:
items: Providing access to educational materials and platform services.
Enhancing user experience and content personalization.
Processing payments and technical support.
Fulfilling legal obligations.
Sending informational and marketing messages (with your consent).
Conducting user behavior analysis and improving platform quality.

items.title: 3. Transfer of data to third parties
items.subtitle: We may transfer your data to third parties in the following cases:
items: Payment systems and technical subcontractors — for the performance of services under the contract.
Marketing partners — with your consent.
Government agencies — in case of a legal request.
In the framework of merger, sale of assets or transfer of business — upon compliance with data protection obligations.

items.title: 4. Cookies and analytics
items.subtitle: We use cookies for:
items: Saving user preferences.
Collecting statistics on website visits and user behavior (for example, using Google Analytics, Meta Pixel and other analytics tools).
Running advertising campaigns and retargeting.

items.title: 5. Your consent
items.subtitle: You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but this may affect the functionality of the site.

items.title: 6. Information protection
items.subtitle: We take technical, administrative and organizational measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, modification, disclosure or destruction.

items.title: 7. User rights
items.subtitle: You have the right to:
items: Request information about your data.
Demand the correction or deletion of your personal data.
Limit or object to the processing of your data.
Withdraw consent to processing (in cases where it is necessary).
File a complaint with the regulatory authority for data protection.

items.title: 8. Changes to the policy
items.subtitle: We reserve the right to make changes to this Policy at any time. The updated version will be published on the website with the date of the last change.

items.title: 9. Contact information
items.subtitle: If you have questions about this Policy or the processing of your personal data, please contact us:
items: Arken Academy
Email: info@arkenacademy.com
Site: https://arkenacademy.com

refund.title: Refund Policy
refund.subtitle: We strive to provide a high-quality educational experience. This refund policy governs the terms for reimbursement for access to training packages and materials purchased on the Arken Academy platform (hereinafter referred to as 'Platform', 'We', 'Company').

items.title: 1. General Principle
items.subtitle: A refund is only possible if the user has not gained access to paid materials and the refund request was made within 24 hours of payment.

items.title: 2. Refund Conditions
items.subtitle: Funds may be refunded if all the following conditions are met:
items: The refund request was made within 24 hours of payment.
The user did not gain access to paid materials.
Payment was made directly via the official website https://arkenacademy.com.
The user provides accurate information for transaction identification.

items.title: 3. Refund Rejection Conditions
items.subtitle: Refunds are not processed if:
items: More than 24 hours have passed since the payment.
The user has gained access to paid materials.
The access was granted via a voucher or within a limited-time offer.
The refund request is made for subjective reasons (e.g., "decided to give up", "expected something else", "simply didn't like it")

items.title: 4. Refund Procedure
items.subtitle: To submit a refund request, please contact us at:
items: info@arkenacademy.com
or through the feedback form on the website.
In the letter, specify:
Name and email, specified at the time of payment
Date and time of payment
Reason for the refund request

items.title: 5. Refund Form
items.subtitle: Funds are returned in the same way as the payment was made, with a deduction of the payment system commission (if applicable).

items.title: 6. Changes to the policy
items.subtitle: We reserve the right to change this refund policy at any time. The updated version will be published on the website with the date of the last change.

item1.name: Timur Alptekin
item1.subtitle: Professional trader with over 10 years of experience. Worked with analytical departments of major European brokers. Specializes in strategies for managing capital from $100,000.
description: Collaborated with independent analytical groups in developing trading models for medium-term trends.
Helped traders build a systematic approach within mentorship programs—from entry setups to position control at volatility levels.
Acted as a consultant in creating checklists and templates for decision-making in high-responsibility trading.
Many of his students today manage professional portfolios or work with investor funds in prop teams.

item2.name: Arslan Kayratov
item2.subtitle: Author of the decision-making system 'Pure Signal' and specialist in psychological resilience in trading. Participated in trader training projects for crypto fund teams in Singapore.
description: Worked with mentorship programs within crypto funds, where a key criterion was trader stability at the moment of decision-making.
Conducted sessions with traders experiencing prolonged drawdowns—focusing on mental recovery and system restructuring.
Helped build adaptive trading journals and behavioral maps that reduced emotional decisions.
His approach combines soft coaching delivery with a strict structure for achieving results.

item3.name: Batyr Tuganov
item3.subtitle: Specialist in volume analysis and CME trading. Regularly consulted on entry strategies for members of closed trading communities.
description: Advised internal prop teams on volume distribution, limit order entries, and reading liquidity order books.
Developed a unique method combining cluster analysis with level-based trading in daily and four-hour timeframes.
Provides mentees with a complete picture of how the market works 'from within': from large participants’ behavior to liquidity mechanics.
Constantly improves materials based on real market case studies.

item4.name: Yerjan Dosmukhamedov
item4.subtitle: Expert in risk management and short-term trading. Conducted internal training sessions for employees of several fintech companies in Eastern Europe.
description: Led internal training sessions for employees of multiple fintech companies in Eastern Europe.
Participated in the development of adaptive risk control systems used daily by trainees at various skill levels.
Regularly leads groups focusing on capital preservation, drawdown management, and psychological resilience.
Her students report improved profitability and a new approach to trading after completing the program.

item5.subtitle: Professional mentor in capital management and medium-term strategies. Advised traders from private banking teams in the Emirates.

Helped design trading modules for capital allocation in unstable macroeconomic cycles.
Manages portfolios ranging from $50K to $500K, focusing on risk reduction and sustainable position growth.
Works with traders for whom trading is not a hobby but part of a long-term investment strategy.
